article.title: Bell-Boeing to Provide CV-22 Radio Frequency Countermeasures
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Bell-Boeing Joint Project Office, Amarillo, Texas, is being awarded an $11,491,794 firm-fixed-price delivery order against a previously issued basic ordering agreement for the procurement of 12 combined retrofit kits for the suite of Integrated Radio Frequency Countermeasures System modifications for the CV-22 aircraft.Â The Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Md., is the contracting activity.
